title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: Suppose mm studies evaluate diagnostic accuracy test. iith study, let $\TPi$: number true positives $\FNi$: number false negatives $\FPi$: number false positives $\TNi$: number true negatives data wish collect =1,…,mi=1,\ldots, m. Write $N_i=\TPi+\FNi$, number cases; $\bar N_i=\FPi + \TNi$, number non-cases; ni=Ni+N‾in_i = N_i + \bar N_i, total sample size. Let pip_i denote sensitivity, qiq_i specificity, πi\pi_i prevalence cases iith study. missing data, can easily estimate $\hat p_i=\TPi/N_i$, $\hat q_i=\TNi/\bar N_i$, π̂=Ni/ni\hat\pi_i=N_i/n_i, respectively. can also feed entire data $(\TPi, \FNi, \FPi, \TNi)$ (=1,…,m)(=1,\ldots, m) standard software, e.g., mada (Sousa-Pinto 2022), meta-analysis.

title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: Consider scenario non-cases study ii, $\FNi$, $\TNi=$NA. example: aim fill missing values $\FNi$ $\TNi$ multiple imputations (MI).
code: library(mtroc) uts #>            TP FN FP  TN #> Ahn        19  0 NA  NA #> Bock        5  5  2  17 #> Chung       5  0 48 114 #> Cordoba    21  1 NA  NA #> Espinosa    5  0 NA  NA #> Haliloglu   3  0  1  73 #> Langer     57 17 NA  NA #> Liberman    6  0 NA  NA #> Nishanova  26  4 NA  NA #> Obenauer    2  2  0  23 #> Oh          9  0 NA  NA #> Qian       50  1 63  92 #> Reyes      32  1 NA  NA #> Robbins     4  0 17 101 #> Taskin     47  0 NA  NA #> Taylor     21  0 NA  NA #> Yang       21  0 NA  NA #> Myers      33  0 NA  NA #> Taron      19  0 NA  NA #> Son         6  0  6  23 #> Jafari     31  0 NA  NA #> Wang      110 18 NA  NA

title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: can think data generated two stages. First, total sample size nin_i, relative size NiN_i vs N‾\bar N_i determined prevalence πi\pi_i. Second, given NiN_i N‾\bar N_i, relative size $\TPi$ vs $\FNi$, $\FPi$ vs $\TNi$, determined sensitivity pip_i specificity qiq_i, respectively. leads us posit two-level model prevalence sensitivity-specificity relationship: first allows us impute size cases non-cases; second impute specificity sensitivity (vice versa). account -study heterogeneity, add study-specific random effects logit scale model. Write ${\rm logit}(x)=\log\{x/(1-x)\}$. $$\begin{align}\tag{1} \logit(\pi_i)&= \alpha_0 + \varepsilon_i\\ \logit(q_i) &= (\beta_0 + b_{0i}) + (\beta_1 + b_{1i})\logit(p_i), \end{align}$$ (α0,β0,β1)(\alpha_0, \beta_0, \beta_1) fixed effects, εi∼N(0,σπ2)\varepsilon_i\sim N(0, \sigma_\pi^2), $b_i=(b_{0i}, b_{1i})^{\rm T}\sim N(0, \Sigma_b)$, εi⊥bi\varepsilon_i\perp b_i. particular, model (1) maximally allows study--study variations prevalence (generally negative) correlation sensitivity specificity. Let 𝒞\mathcal C denote set indices complete data observed. Thus ∈𝒞ii\\mathcal C_i, complete estimates π̂\hat\pi, p̂\hat p_i, q̂\hat q_i. Using pseudo-observations (1), can estimate parameters $\hat\alpha=\mbox{mean}\{\logit(\hat\pi_i): \\mathcal C\}$, $\hat\sigma_\pi^2=\mbox{var}\{\logit(\hat\pi_i): \\mathcal C\}$, β̂=\hat\beta= least-squares estimate $\logit(\hat q_i) \mbox{ vs }\logit(\hat p_i)$ (∈𝒞)(\\mathcal C). Finally, Σb\Sigma_b can estimated Σ̂b=|𝒞|var̂(β̂)\hat\Sigma_b=|\mathcal C|\hat{\mbox{var}}(\hat\beta), |𝒞||\mathcal C| number studies 𝒞\mathcal C var̂(β̂)\hat{\mbox{var}}(\hat\beta) estimated variance matrix β̂\hat\beta standard least squares.

title: Multiple imputations by two-level model
text: $\\overline{\mathcal C}=\{=1,\ldots, m: \FNi \mbox{ } \TNi \mbox{ missing}\}$, know NiN_i p̂\hat p_i, impute $\FNi$ $\TNi$. multiple times drawing random effects model (1), order account certainty missing values. jjth imputation, ∈𝒞¯\\overline{\mathcal C}: Draw εi(j)∼N(0,σ̂π2)\varepsilon_i^{(j)}\sim N(0, \hat\sigma_\pi^2); bi(j)∼N(0,Σ̂b)b_i^{(j)}\sim N(0,\hat\Sigma_b); Compute π̂(j)\hat\pi_i^{(j)} q̂(j)\hat q_i^{(j)} inserting α̂0\hat\alpha_0, εi(j)\varepsilon_i^{(j)}, β̂\hat\beta, bi(j)b_i^{(j)} model (1); Impute missing values N‾(j)=Ni(1−π̂(j))/π̂(j)\bar N_i^{(j)}= N_i(1-\hat\pi_i^{(j)})/\hat\pi_i^{(j)}, $\FNi^{(j)} = \bar N_i^{(j)}(1-\hat q_i^{(j)})$, $\TNi^{(j)} = \bar N_i^{(j)}\hat q_i^{(j)}$. thus obtain completed dataset $$ \mathcal D^{(j)}= \{(\TPi, \FNi, \FPi^{(j)}, \TNi^{(j)}): =1,\ldots, m\}, $$ define $\FPi^{(j)}=\FPi$ $\TNi^{(j)}=\TNi$ ∈𝒞i\\mathcal C. Given 𝒟(j)\mathcal D^{(j)}, can use standard software meta-analysis obtain summary measure diagnostic accuracy, say, summary AUC, denoted $\hat{\rm AUC}^{(j)}$. may also obtain variance $\hat{\rm var}(\hat{\rm AUC}^{(j)})$. Repeat j=1,…,Jj =1,\ldots, J (e.g., J=500J=500). compute multiply imputed AUC $$ \hat{\rm AUC}=J^{-1}\sum_{j=1}^J\hat{\rm AUC}^{(j)}, $$ variance $$ \hat{\rm var}(\hat{\rm AUC}) = \underbrace{J^{-1}\sum_{j=1}^J(\hat{\rm AUC}^{(j)} -\hat{\rm AUC})^2}_{\rm -imputation} + \underbrace{J^{-1}\sum_{j=1}^J\hat{\rm var}(\hat{\rm AUC}^{(j)})}_{\rm within-imputation}. $$ computations can done logit scale AUC improve accuracy approximation.
